item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Friday, September 13, 2024 at 9:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Reasons I still love the fish shell (50 points | 21 comments)
2. Factor 0.100 now available (24 points | 4 comments)
3. OpenAI O1 Model (22 points | 12 comments)
4. Wallops: A modern IRC client for classic Mac OS (20 points | no comments)
5. Conditionally Disabling Code with Comptime in Zig (19 points | 8 comments)
6. What’s in an e-graph? (21 points | 3 comments)
7. Vulnerability Disclosure of Feeld (dating app) (20 points | 9 comments)
8. Ergo: Erlang-inspired event driven actor framework in Go (23 points | 7 comments)
9. Ruffle: Optimisations, Text Input, Tab Focusing and More (14 points | 2 comments)
10. JSR and Deno: Final Review (10 points | 4 comments)
11. Porting C to Rust for a Fast and Safe AV1 Media Decoder (32 points | 3 comments)
12. The First HTML LSP That Reports Syntax Errors (95 points | 24 comments)
13. Fediverse Discovery Providers (10 points | 4 comments)
14. Making libjson RFC 8259 compilant (3 points | no comments)
15. Optimizing rav1d, an AV1 Decoder in Rust (9 points | no comments)
16. Jonathan Rees on "What is Object-Oriented?" (2001) (5 points | 4 comments)
17. RIPE Atlas probes, the world's largest Internet monitoring system (15 points | 2 comments)
18. Always support compressed response in an API service (7 points | 7 comments)
19. Remix's concurrent submissions are fundamentally flawed (without causal ordering) - Dashbit Blog (5 points | no comments)
20. Better-performing “25519” elliptic-curve cryptography (1 points | no comments)
21. The first release candidate of FreeCAD 1.0 is out (19 points | 1 comment)
22. Proposal for Emoji: Eye Bags Face (44 points | 12 comments)
23. The Reinforcing Nature of Toil (1 points | no comments)
24. Performance Improvements in .NET 9 (4 points | no comments)
25. We spent $20 to achieve RCE and accidentally became the admins of .MOBI (90 points | 6 comments)
item.guid: Lobsters Top Stories: Friday, September 13, 2024 at 9:15 AM UTC
